businessProfile.name: Carbone
businessProfile.address: ARIA Resort & Casino, 3730 Las Vegas Fwy, Las Vegas, NV 89109, USA
businessProfile.formatted_address: ARIA Resort & Casino, 3730 Las Vegas Fwy, Las Vegas, NV 89109, USA

reviews.text:
This ended up being our favorite restaurant of the entire trip‚Äîwe loved it so much that I‚Äôm already planning to come back next month!

I‚Äôll admit, I was a little nervous when I saw the low Google rating. But I also noticed how hard it was to get a reservation, so I took a chance. I did have to wait about 30 minutes even with a reservation, which wasn‚Äôt ideal‚Äîbut everything after that more than made up for it.

The food was incredible. I loved the spicy vodka sauce, and the veal Parmesan (especially the bone) was a standout. The drinks were just as impressive‚Äîhands down the best espresso martini I‚Äôve ever had.

Service was top-notch. Richard and William were both attentive, warm, and fun‚Äîthey even did a little whiskey tasting with us. They really helped make the night special.

the spicy vodka rigatoni was exceptional üòç the chef made a great ceasar salad at the table side as well, it was a little heavy on the garlic but still delicious. drinks were phenomenal and the staff/service was great and very accommodating. they ended up taking a dish off of our bill due to the wait time which was appreciated.

Amazing food and vibe, very nice and attentive service, lamb chops were really good and juicy and the sauces complimented them well. The breads were nice and warm and very very tasty, they gave a decent serving of parmesan cheese to go with it and it was really good. The portions are pretty big and it's mostly family style so you can order a couple dishes and share. The pasta portions were good for one or two people but the entree like the chicken dish was huge.

One of the best Italian-American restaurants I‚Äôve been to and that‚Äôs saying a lot! The veal here is absolutely exceptional. Cocktails are great, and service is impeccable. They could definitely use some help in the interior design department as the tables are quite uncomfortable. Although it‚Äôs a cool look and aesthetically pleasing, the uncomfortable seating is to the point where it takes away from the experience. I‚Äôll still give this a five star review because it really is that good. It‚Äôs of course extremely expensive but it‚Äôs a hotel casino in Vegas and that‚Äôs how they are these days. I hope they continue to pursue excellence in their menu because there are some dishes with some slight room from improvement, but most of all I really hope they improve their interior design. Specifically in the aspect of comfort.

We had a great time here! The service was actually really great and was a stand-out point unlike many other reviews here. The complimentary bread was AMAZING the pizza foccacia was divine. The caesar salad is definitely anchovy heavy, not quite to my taste but my partner really enjoyed. The rigatoni vodka was extremely salty and I sent back for a lite-salt version, which they were more than happy to accommodate and remake. Overall the ambience is lovely - the food is on the saltier side but it was a great experience!

editorial_summary.overview: High-end takes on red-sauce fare await at this hip Italian restaurant in a retro-glam space.

recentReviews.text: Great spot for a large group dinner. We were celebrating with clients and had the private room which was perfect. We ordered the tomahawk, 2 spicy rigatoni‚Äôs, tortellini al ragu branzino, rolls, and caprese salads

Outstanding and amazing. Service was beyond what I thought.
The food was spectacular. We had our wedding dinner here. It did not disappoint. We are from Dallas and are happy we chose to try this location first. The Dallas location will have very high standards to meet.

Thanks you all for making it an even more memorable evening.

Really disappointing experience. üò§

We showed up on time with a reservation, dressed up, and still waited 30 minutes. When we politely asked, the host seemed annoyed. Our server never explained the menu to us, but did a full intro for the table next to us. He even dropped utensils on our table without looking‚Äîso rude. üíîWe paid $150+ per person and stayed polite the whole time, but got treated like this. Honestly, worst dining experience I‚Äôve had in Vegas‚ÄîIn-N-Out was better.

Food quality was good; Captain's table service delivery was the worst fine dining experience of our lives...no exaggeration. He (no introduction) listed the specials he could remember, missing the lobster cocktail, among others, which sounded amazing when we got to hear about them listening to Athena deliver them to the table next to ours.

We selected the caprese salad, because I saw on the menu, that was not mentioned to us as their seasonal special with freshly made mozzarella and seasonal vine riped tomatoes...which we learned listening to other tables receiving recommendations.
Our Captain only came to check-in on us during the 30-45 minute wait between our pasta and $150 NY strip while we sat with empty white plates in front of us, frowning, as we listened to the amazing experience the table next to us was receiving.
So...after seeing our table neighbor's meal order (that was identical to our own) arrive with reasonable timing between dishes, after they'd received beautifully delivered recommendations, and enjoyed frequent table check-ins from their Captain to ensure their satisfaction, I asked our server, (who was great) to speak with management. Once management arrived, they listened to my polite summary and stated they agreed with me that the Captain working the table next to us, Athena, was the Superhero of the establishment and ours needed a time-out for additional training. I felt better for getting to vent, but received no apology or reasonable accomodation towards the $500 meal-for-two experience disaster we'd just endured.
We decided to skip desert and get the hell out of the establishment. We left 20% gratuity as our server, Keith, was amazingly attentive in watching our beverage refills, clearing plates, and efforts trying to connect... perhaps in response to what was lacking from our table Captain. We hope Keith's promoted to an establishment that deserves him as Carbone is a $500 dinner-for-two disaster unless sitting in Athena's section.
Not sure what the hate is about. A+ food, great service. Pricey but worth it

I was stunned by the level of service, the quality of the food, and the gorgeous romantic atmosphere. Athena was so incredibly impressive and made our experience perfect. I would come back in a heartbeat!!
Place is great, another all time Vegas favorite for me. Anytime we‚Äôre in Vegas we always try to get a reservation!!! Never disappoints!!

Honestly my favorite restaurant in the entire world. My husband and I always make it a point to come here every time we‚Äôre in Vegas. We‚Äôd literally kill for the Spicy Rigatoni! The Parmesan and salami before the meal with the pickled vegetables is also incredible.

detailedReviews.author: Marc G
detailedReviews.text: Great spot for a large group dinner. We were celebrating with clients and had the private room which was perfect. We ordered the tomahawk, 2 spicy rigatoni‚Äôs, tortellini al ragu branzino, rolls, and caprese salads

detailedReviews.author: r ferrusca
detailedReviews.text:
Outstanding and amazing. Service was beyond what I thought.
The food was spectacular. We had our wedding dinner here. It did not disappoint. We are from Dallas and are happy we chose to try this location first. The Dallas location will have very high standards to meet.

Thanks you all for making it an even more memorable evening.

detailedReviews.author: Bella Li
detailedReviews.text:
Really disappointing experience. üò§

We showed up on time with a reservation, dressed up, and still waited 30 minutes. When we politely asked, the host seemed annoyed. Our server never explained the menu to us, but did a full intro for the table next to us. He even dropped utensils on our table without looking‚Äîso rude. üíîWe paid $150+ per person and stayed polite the whole time, but got treated like this. Honestly, worst dining experience I‚Äôve had in Vegas‚ÄîIn-N-Out was better.

detailedReviews.text:

He (no introduction) listed the specials he could remember, missing the lobster cocktail, among others, which sounded amazing when we got to hear about them listening to Athena deliver them to the table next to ours.

So...after seeing our table neighbor's meal order (that was identical to our own) arrive with reasonable timing between dishes, after they'd received beautifully delivered recommendations, and enjoyed frequent table check-ins from their Captain to ensure their satisfaction, I asked our server, (who was great) to speak with management. Once management arrived, they listened to my polite summary and stated they agreed with me that the Captain working the table next to us, Athena, was the Superhero of the establishment and ours needed a time-out for additional training. We decided to skip desert and get the hell out of the establishment. We left 20% gratuity as our server, Keith, was amazingly attentive in watching our beverage refills, clearing plates, and efforts trying to connect... perhaps in response to what was lacking from our table Captain. detailedReviews.author: Dan Toomey Jr
detailedReviews.text: Not sure what the hate is about. A+ food, great service. Pricey but worth it

detailedReviews.author: lila pea
detailedReviews.text: I was stunned by the level of service, the quality of the food, and the gorgeous romantic atmosphere. Athena was so incredibly impressive and made our experience perfect. I would come back in a heartbeat!!

detailedReviews.author: Jordan G.
detailedReviews.text: Place is great, another all time Vegas favorite for me. Anytime we‚Äôre in Vegas we always try to get a reservation!!! Never disappoints!!

detailedReviews.author: Disha Sharma Allen
detailedReviews.text: Honestly my favorite restaurant in the entire world. My husband and I always make it a point to come here every time we‚Äôre in Vegas. We‚Äôd literally kill for the Spicy Rigatoni! The Parmesan and salami before the meal with the pickled vegetables is also incredible.

detailedReviews.author: Monica Niter
detailedReviews.text: This was my anniversary dinner and also a way to celebrate my husband‚Äôs birthday too! We explained this on the reservation and seems none of the information was seen. Reservation at 9. Seated at 9:30 and they close at 10:30 which I feel already set us up for failure. We sat down and got drinks from a server who was more attentive than our actual ‚Äúcaptain‚Äù the whole night and I can‚Äôt say thank you enough for him. Our captain basically ignored us all night, but was attentive with tables all around us. He only checked on us once the food arrived. We quickly ate just to get out the restaurant and enjoy our anniversary. We were even brought an incorrect check up charging desserts we didn‚Äôt order‚Ä¶ do better. We were excited and now have no desire to return

detailedReviews.author: Stacey Fern
detailedReviews.text: I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this restaurant to anyone, food was decent, bartender was lacking food knowledge, service was horrendous, never checked on us once, if you want a memorable Vegas experience go anywhere else.

detailedReviews.author: balpreet singh
detailedReviews.text: I booked table at 9:15 and it‚Äôs 10:52 and I‚Äôm still here and all I have till now is 3 appetizers and still waiting on main course. I would not recommend anyone coming here cause there are much better places with way better service and food. This is my first and last time I‚Äôm ever coming to this horrible place.

detailedReviews.author: Kim C
detailedReviews.text: We had dinner at Carbone in Vegas on 9/1/25.  It is over-rated and over-priced. The decor is beautiful but it was so loud I could not hear anything. The service was very good. The food was mediocre at best and too pretentious. The spaghetti pomodoro did not have a red sauce. It was noodles with some tomatoes.  The veal Marsala was not the thin veal cutlets most restaurants do. Instead, it was Big chunks of meat and mushrooms with a sauce that was not great.  They did take that off the bill which was nice. If you want good Italian food in Vegas there are better less expensive options.  Try Capos. It is off strip but everything we have tried there was amazing.

detailedReviews.author: Scott Sanders
detailedReviews.text: This restaurant is said to be one of the hardest reservations to secure in Vegas.  I don‚Äôt understand why.  Carbone imposes a two hour dining limit, but they ran 30 minutes late on seating us for our confirmed reservation.  In the meantime, they don‚Äôt allow you to order drinks at the bar and the bartender is a first class jerk.  What Vegas establishment passes up selling $30 drinks?  Carbone is very loud and definitely not for a romantic dinner.  We complained several times about the table next to us who were in near fisticuffs fighting and shouting at each other.  Thinking someone could get hit any minute was beyond tense.  The food quality is subpar.  The ribs were overcooked and overspiced.  The pasta was cold.  The bread service was the best part of the meal.  In all, this is an overrated restaurant and not worth the effort it takes to secure a reservation.

detailedReviews.author: Ftrader
detailedReviews.text: We had a lively dinner here. Everything was perfect. A little expensive but nothing wasn't good

detailedReviews.author: Lia
detailedReviews.text: Made a reservation at 7:15. Checked in and was told it would be a 30 minute wait at least. What is the point of a reservation if you have to wait that long? There were plenty of open tables visible inside as well.

detailedReviews.author: Edward Moye
detailedReviews.text: Took the family including my 6 year old out for a dinner. Great food, great service, great atmosphere. Will be back next time we are in the area.

detailedReviews.author: B C
detailedReviews.text: One of the best restaurants I‚Äôve been to. You can tell the staff take great pride in their work. Special shout out to Julie for the phenomenal recommendations and experience! ‚ù§Ô∏è

detailedReviews.author: Jayhad Abdellatif
detailedReviews.text: I would say without a doubt the most overrated food experience. Outside of the mediocre food , the waiter we had was absolutely horrible. The waiters here get mad and don‚Äôt come back to you if you don‚Äôt order the whole menu apparently. There‚Äôs so much better Italian options I don‚Äôt really understand the hype of this place at all.

detailedReviews.author: George Faerber III
detailedReviews.text: If you say this is the best restaurant you are only doing it cause of the hype. It‚Äôs like they just gave up

detailedReviews.author: Elle D
detailedReviews.text: Have been coming here for yearsssssss always a must stop FOR GOOD DINNER ! Always consistent. Staff are A+++++++ crowd unfortunately has changed a little less sophisticated. But oh well we always enjoy food, and excellent service!  I wish I would have more ppl watch with better dressed style ( but that‚Äôs just me ). Hate to see men in shorts and women in casual day dresses ‚Ä¶ you can do better! The hostesses, waiters dress with more OOMFFFF

detailedReviews.author: Gabrielle Esquibel
detailedReviews.text:
Been to the NYC location and had a great experience so decided to try it out in Vegas.

We ordered 2 espresso martinis and an aperol spritz. The espresso martinis were so weirdly thick? And the aperol spritz didn‚Äôt even fill the glass. For over $20 a drink you‚Äôd like it to not be half full.

Our waiter recommended to us to order multiple courses of food. We weren‚Äôt that hungry so we decided on a salad for the table and a pasta for each guest.

Her entire tune changed when we did not listen to her recommendation in an effort to not waste food and it immediately felt hostile.

It felt like she immediately became dismissive and did not care about our table any longer since we weren‚Äôt going to have a $1000 bill.

When we finally got our food, she came up to our table and rudely asked if it was enough food - as if she was trying to prove her point.

It was more than enough food‚Ä¶. Just a really weird experience that left a bad taste in my mouth.

detailedReviews.author: Abdulaziz
detailedReviews.text: The food and atmosphere at Carbone were excellent, but the service from our waiter, Solomon, made the experience unpleasant. Unlike with the other three tables around us where he spoke normally and provided attentive service - with us he barely said a few words, pointed with his fingers when we asked about the menu, and gestured for us to move our own plates when bringing dishes. His dismissive attitude seemed directed only toward our table, which was disappointing and overshadowed what should have been a great dining experience.

detailedReviews.author: MARIO IVANCIC
detailedReviews.text: The food, the concept and the atmosphere is fabulous but you need to shorten a waiting time , never experienced such a long waiting time, 45 minutes.This ain‚Äôt happening in Carbone Miami. Been there!

detailedReviews.author: Jelena I
detailedReviews.text: Worst experience, our reservation got cancelled and we got charged the no show fee. When we arrived to the restaurant we were greeted by the not so friendly staff and informed that because we did not arrive right on time that our reservation is cancelled, however there was a 15 min grace period which was not honoured. I would not recommend choosing Carbone as a dinner option definitely not a good experience.

detailedReviews.author: kass weems
detailedReviews.text: EAT SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!! LAVO, RPM, SINATRAS, FERRAROS instead!! the hosts were very rude‚Ä¶ they prioritized tables that were over 15 minutes late for their time slots over reservations actively waiting. Dark haired host and taller dark skin host were chatting very loudly about drama‚Ä¶ when you walk up they continued chatting before addressing you with nasty looks, the restaurant isn‚Äôt exclusive members only‚Ä¶ so there‚Äôs no reason for those hosts girls to act they way that they did. They were extremely passive aggressive for AGAIN no reason at all. I see why they have 3 stars on here and honestly it starts at the door‚Ä¶ after waiting over an hour (30 mins of which were past our reservation time‚Ä¶ 7:45pm while we were repeatedly told we are still waiting on a few 7:15‚Äôs & 7:30‚Äôs AT 8:15?!?) and checking in MULTIPLE times with the hosts we decided to cancel which the host then suggest trying the food court instead??

detailedReviews.author: tony gangarossa
detailedReviews.text: Brandon the GM has done a spectacular job running this place. Very accommodating and food is top top notch

detailedReviews.author: Ameya D
detailedReviews.text: Everything except wait times was perfect! ü§åüèº

detailedReviews.author: Sawyer Evans
detailedReviews.text: One of the best dining experiences I have ever had in Las Vegas! From the atmosphere to service, Carbone was incredible and exquisite! I will definitely be coming back to this restaurant to try other items on the menu. I highly suggest checking out the desserts, especially the cheesecake.

detailedReviews.author: Jenny chacon
detailedReviews.text: Un restaurante 100% recomendado: todos sus platos son deliciosos y el ambiente es muy agradable, perfecto para disfrutar y volver una y otra vez.

detailedReviews.author: Amanda Baldino
detailedReviews.text:
We had a really wonderful experience at Carbone last night. Dion was our server and we hit it off with him from the start - his recommendations were top notch and his attention to detail was impeccable. He is what made our night really great, alongside the waitstaff supporting him!

I will say, front of house service was a little to be desired and everyone was a little stiff/rude at the check-in desk. But back of house more than made up for it.

Thanks for a great night!

detailedReviews.author: Sydney Grove McNamara
detailedReviews.text: Couldn‚Äôt express more of a 5 star experience from Carbone. We have been anxiously awaiting a reservation at Carbone the past few times we came to Vegas. Dion was our captain and he was absolutely impeccable. Can‚Äôt wait to come back ü•∞

detailedReviews.author: kristen lubig
detailedReviews.text: the spicy vodka rigatoni was exceptional üòç the chef made a great ceasar salad at the table side as well, it was a little heavy on the garlic but still delicious. drinks were phenomenal and the staff/service was great and very accommodating. they ended up taking a dish off of our bill due to the wait time which was appreciated.

detailedReviews.author: angelo vazeos
detailedReviews.text:
Just so you know.. they won't seat you until your entire party arrives. So, don't be surprised if they won't seat you.

Anyway, when everyone finally arrived, we were taken through a maze of different rooms until we finally took our seats in a dimly lit area, adorned with lovely, red velvety curtains.  This location is about 2500% bigger than the one in NYC.

The service was tight, but I'd say that our server could've turned it down about 25% to less talky.  Otherwise, nice professional staff that included at least three different members catering to us.

With three in our group, we started with drinks.. a Spicy Margherita, a Cosmopolitan, and I ordered a wonderful medium bodied glass of Cabernet, before originally tasting an even more outstanding and full bodied one, that was over $70.  I settled for the $40 glass which was still absolutely delicious.

The menus were very large for the amount of writing that was on them.

As a starter to the table they sent us a basket of different breads, with focaccia, toasted garlic, and a nice sesame seeded semolina, all of which were outstanding.  Also complimentary, was a plate of capicola/salami, which went well with the breads.

We added nine baked little neck clams that had three different styles. A classic oregonato, which tasted fine, but maybe a little drier than expected. The other was a clams casino style, then there was my favorite.. the raw one, which tasted best to me overall.  With a squirt of lemon onto a decent amount of meat, these clams were delicious.

We shared the prosciutto with melon, which included both cantaloupe and honeydew.  Melons were sweet and the prosciutto succulently salty, making for a delicious combination.

We shared a deliciously crisp Caesar Salad and a Spicy Rigatoni Vodka, that was cooked to perfection and very easy to just devour.  I included an order of the broccoli rabe, which was possibly the best I've ever had.

We were too full for dessert, but enjoyed a coffee to help us stay up for a little bit of midnight gambling.  The desserts looked great and were probably as delicious as everything else was.  Pricey, but delicious.

detailedReviews.author: rose hisham
detailedReviews.text: Our waiter was nice, too much noise everyone was shouting I dont know why hahaha, I couldn‚Äôt tell if there was music or no. Food was fantastic!

detailedReviews.author: derrick songsu chong
detailedReviews.text:
A Disappointing Dining Experience

I walked in with high expectations, only to leave with disappointment. I took my wife and mother out for what was supposed to be a nice dinner.

The issues began right when we placed our order. We wanted to try a variety of dishes to sample different flavors, including their signature Porterhouse steak. I asked our server about the portion sizes to make sure we weren‚Äôt ordering too much. Instead of giving a clear answer, he insisted we also order his personal favorite‚Äîthe New York strip‚Äîdespite my concerns about the quantity. He reassured me it wouldn‚Äôt be too much, so we agreed.

After taking our order, the server essentially disappeared. He spent most of the evening chatting with another table, who seemed to be his friends, and never once checked in to see if we needed anything. In a fine dining restaurant, attentive service is expected, but that was not the case here.

When the food began arriving, support staff practically tossed the plates onto our table without a word. To make matters worse, my mother‚Äôs chair wobbled the entire time. I initially thought the floor was uneven, but it turned out one of the legs was simply shorter. When I told the server, he casually told us to switch chairs ourselves. I suggested he do it, and while he eventually swapped it with a nearby chair, he left the broken one sitting there.

As for the food‚Äîappetizers and bread were fine, but the pasta was unimpressive. Both the Porterhouse and the New York strip we ordered medium came out closer to well-done, dry, and difficult to eat. The server never asked if the steaks were cooked to our liking and never checked in after they arrived. The portions were enormous, far more than we could eat, and he didn‚Äôt even ask if we wanted more wine. He was too busy talking to the other table, who, I later noticed, were apparently well-known, as several staff members were taking photos with them.

We ended up barely touching the steaks and had to wait quite a while to get them boxed to go. He didn‚Äôt even ask if we wanted dessert. By that point, we just wanted to leave.

The bill came to over $700. I‚Äôm normally a generous tipper, but for the first time, I questioned whether the server deserved anything at all. Out of basic courtesy, I still left $100.

As someone who frequently visits Las Vegas to enjoy great food and has dined at many restaurants, this was by far one of the worst dinners I‚Äôve ever had.

detailedReviews.author: Thomas Chopper Russo
detailedReviews.text: Always a great great meal fantastic atmosphere tremendous service. We were fortunate enough to get the Dynamic Duo, Chris and Keith that were spot on with everything that we needed was fortunate to get the chicken Parmesan that is an off the menu item been coming here since they open, never disappointing mealappreciate the cauliflower, salami and cheese along with the fabulous breads that they bring to you as soon as you sit down and meal, as always was exceptional fantastic vibe at this go to location

detailedReviews.author: mayya nehrych
detailedReviews.text: overly-priced for extremely mediocre food. long wait even with a reservation. the service was the only thing that was actually good and the servers at least seem very knowledgeable, however the food is just definitely not worth the price‚Ä¶ i mean what a disappointment. i thought you couldn‚Äôt go wrong with a classic spaghetti and meatballs. BOY was i wrong. cocktail menu was also not impressive with only basic cocktails on the menu. the point of a cocktail menu is to have drinks on there that aren‚Äôt classic cocktail because if that‚Äôs what you want, you‚Äôll order it either way on or off menu. wouldn‚Äôt recommend. so many other restaurants near that i‚Äôd rather spend money at.

detailedReviews.author: Mike edward
detailedReviews.text: Awesome place to eat

detailedReviews.author: Justin G
detailedReviews.text: This was one of the worst restaurant experiences that I‚Äôve ever had in Las Vegas. The service was terrible. The food wasn‚Äôt hot especially their special pasta the carbine pasta. We didn‚Äôt get drinks for 45 minutes. They left dirty plates on our table after being done with food and argued with us when we asked our clean plates for our salad after having seafood and other remnants on our plate. They said we should only get one plate for all the courses before the salad.  The main part of the restaurant feels like you‚Äôre in a low end restaurant.  The back room is a little nicer.  I would never recommend anyone waste their time going and eating at this restaurant when there‚Äôs so many better options in town.  Not worth the price at all.

detailedReviews.author: j. medrano
detailedReviews.text:
One of the worst dining experiences I've ever had.

We had an amazing dinner at Carbone Dallas a couple years ago and were really looking forward to visiting Carbone Las Vegas for months leading up to our trip.

We arrived at the restaurant about 25 min before our reservation.  I checked in with the host and was told 'your table is no where near ready.  Try back at your reservation time.'  I thought that was a little weird.  Most restaurants atleast will offer getting drinks at the bar while waiting for a table.  We went down to the casino until closer to our reservation time.

We arrived back at the restaurant at our reservation time and checked back in with the host again.  She asked to wait a couple more minutes before finally being able to take us to our table.

We watched as tables around us that were seated after us were greeted and handed menus.  After about 15 min a back waiter came and asked us if we wanted to order drinks.  (We were still not offered a menu).  Finally after about 25 min, our server finally came to the table handed us menus and then immediately said "so do you know what you want to order".  We said that since we were just handed the menus we'd need a couple of min to look at it.
After about 5 min, our server returned to take our order.  Once again we were asked 'so do know what you want'.  We mentioned that we had some amazing meatballs at Carbone Dallas that were on special and asked if they had any specials for the evening.  Our server than rudely says 'of couse.  we are known for our specials'.  It was followed by awkward silence where we were waiting for him to tell us the specials.  We had to then ask 'well are you able to tell us what the specials are.'  The server finally told us the specials.   We asked about a couple of the dishes again cause it was really hard to hear him, but ended up just ordering off the menu.  When it came to ordering the Shrimp Su'modo dish, our server cut us off and just said 'scampi'.  My partner said 'oh it says shrimp su'modo'.  The server rudely said 'that means for you.  but we can cook it scampi style'.  I said well if that's how it comes, that would be great.  He then said 'no we offer it 3 different ways.'  I asked him if he could tell us about those 3 different ways since I didn't see it on the menu how that could be done.  He seemed to roll his eyes at us and tell us the 3 different names of styles it could be cooked.  I wasn't familiar with the other ways he said, so I asked if he could tell us more about those styles.  He once again rolled his eyes at us.   At this point, we were both very frustrated with the service.

We watched as food started coming out to tables that were seated and ordered after us from the same server.  Finally our appetizers started to come out over 1 hour after we had been seated.   I had to flag down a back waiter to try and put in another drink order as it seemed no one was coming to check on our table.

Thankfully the food was actually good, but the lack of service and horrible service when someone finally did come to our table left us really wanting to get out of there.  I tried to flag down our server and the back waiter to see if we could get our check to leave.  I finally had to flag down what seemed to be a manager in a suit to ask for our check.  When we were about to be handed our check, the server returned and tried to take away the check and said 'but wait, you haven't gotten your rainbow cookies'.  I let him know we were ready to leave now and didn't want to wait.

Honestly this dinner was the biggest disappointment and I cannot stress how bad service was.  With so many great dining options in Las Vegas, please go somewhere that wants your business.

detailedReviews.author: KB
detailedReviews.text: Quite possibly the worst meal I‚Äôve ever had in Vegas.  $1900 lit on fire.  Do yourself a favor and just go to Sinatra at Encore.

detailedReviews.author: jackie Bahadur
detailedReviews.text:
I‚Äôm writing to share some feedback regarding our recent visit to your restaurant this past weekend. We were a party of 11 celebrating my husband‚Äôs birthday and had been looking forward to a special evening with friends and family ‚Äî some of whom traveled from out of town for the occasion.

Unfortunately, our experience was affected by what seemed to be a miscommunication regarding a minimum spend agreement. I believe our host had coordinated something with the restaurant ahead of time, but this was never communicated to me or others in our party.

Throughout the evening, our waiter repeatedly approached me, mentioning that we had not yet met a $700 or $500 minimum spend, and encouraged us to order more food and drinks. While we understand that large groups often come with certain requirements, the repeated reminders during the meal felt intrusive and disrupted the flow of what should have been a relaxed and enjoyable celebration.

We chose Carbone for its ambiance and reputation, and we were hoping for a seamless experience. I‚Äôm sharing this feedback in the hope that it can help improve communication and service for future large parties, particularly when special occasions are involved.

detailedReviews.author: Brittni Gerber
detailedReviews.text:
I was really excited to go here. However, first the
steak took a very long time to come out, we asked for it to go and they never brought it and then  I told the waiter it was my boyfriend‚Äôs birthday and they never came and brought anything. Very very disappointed. Won‚Äôt be coming back next time.

detailedReviews.author: Helen Chang
detailedReviews.text: The bread, cheese, octopus, and calamari were mind blowing!!

detailedReviews.author: A Bousi
detailedReviews.text:
We came here for a wedding  dinner. The food, service and ambience were perfect.
The warm focaccia and salami to start are amazing.
The salad and pickled cauliflower delicious.
The spicy rigatoni is a must have.
Baked clams delicious.
Tuna tataki was so soft and perfect.
The lamb chops are perfectly cooked and seasoned.
The spicy lobster is delicious.
Everyone loved the macaroni with mushrooms.
Veal parm was a big hit but not my favourite.
Of the desserts the carrot cake was the biggest hit.

detailedReviews.author: Madison Lane
detailedReviews.text: The Aria‚Äôs restaurants leave little to be desired EXCEPT for Carbone. The service and the food left this party of four hungry and dissatisfied, so much so that I would leave 0 stars if possible. My family and I came to Carbone hungry and eager. We had tried to eat at the restaurant a year prior without reservations and were disappointed when we realized how busy the restaurant was. This year, we decided to make reservations in advance to get into the highly regarded restaurant. Our reservations were at 8:30pm. We waited for 45 minutes to be seated despite our reservation time. We understood that the time other patrons take to eat is not in the control of the staff, so initially we did not find this to be a big deal. Once seated, we waited 20 minutes for our server to greet us and then another 30 minutes to receive the restaurants complimentary antipasto (bread, salami, and cauliflower). We watched as many other guests seated after us received this antipasto well before us. When our main course arrived it was luke warm at best. The food was fine. The taste wasn‚Äôt exceptional, especially for the price tag, but what was really disappointing was the service. We watched as many other people received their food with gorgeous table side service. Servers were cutting fish table side and serving it to the other patrons. We ordered the Branzino and when our fish arrived, no one offered to cut it. We had to ask our server and he looked appalled that we wanted our fish cut. After tasting the fish, it was quite frankly one of the worst fish dishes we have ever had. Our server only touched the table three times during the course of our meal. We understand that the restaurant is very busy and popular, but the service left much to be desired. We asked the bartender for the manager twice before he came to the table. He seemed bothered by our concerns and didn‚Äôt address the issues as needed. In the end, the issues were not amended properly. They took the Branzino and the veal (another dish that our whole table did not find enjoyable) off of the check.  They offered us a mediocre dessert and we still paid over $300 for a very average meal. I would not recommend this Carbone location to anyone. The service is inconsistent and the food is not as good as the price tag and popularity would suggest. We were very displeased.  If you are looking for a great meal I would avoid this place and seek elsewhere, like the neighbor Jean George Steak House.

detailedReviews.author: Andrew M
detailedReviews.text: Food is incredible. Service is top notch. Loved it. Got the caesar, meatballs, spicy rigatoni vodka, veal parmesan, dover piccata and cheesecake. Atmosphere is fun, cool spot, everyone is dressed up, lots of famous people.

detailedReviews.author: H C
detailedReviews.text: Came here from Canada, it's a popular place, tourism in Vegas kinda dying though. This place kind keeps it alive and the tacos on the strip. Food and service is great. I would comeback if Vegas wasn't such a money grabber.

detailedReviews.author: Nya Brooks
detailedReviews.text: Don‚Äôt let popularity fool you I was so nervous coming here on one hand seeing the reviews on social media platforms such as TikTok giving it a 10 out of 10 and then on the other hand reading reviews on Google saying that the service is horrible and that the workers are rude and I‚Äôm here to tell you 2 things can be true at once. The food in my opinion is okay it isn‚Äôt the best or the worst. The service is horrible that is a fact rudeness from start to finish if you can still enjoy your meal after every staff member you encounter being rude to you then you 100% should eat here. The wait time even with a reservation is also long. So as long as you take all these things into account you‚Äôll be fine but in my opinion I did it just to say I did it but I did not enjoy it and you couldn‚Äôt even pay me to do it again

detailedReviews.author: mike Stacks
detailedReviews.text: Have to be honest people.  This place is üíØ overrated.  The server was good until we order our glass of wine. After that we never saw him again. Seemed like he was angry we didn't order a expensive dinner meal instead of side dishes.  What blew my mind was how expensive there shrimp cocktail is. $40 for 5 shrimp that were large. Not XL but just little over average size. No where did on the menu did it say 40$or I would have never got them. And besides the price they were horrible. Didn't seem fresh, we're kind of hard and this red seasoning to them. This place just seems way overpriced and while the other dishes were good,  nothing blew me away. I hate to drop 200 on a dinner when you have these hidden prices, below avergae service which was good for the 1st 30 min and then fell flat to bad.  As a server you take our order, get our drinks, everyone else brings the food and refills water and then you show at the end for your tip. Must be nice to have everyone else do your work for you and you get the tip... I will never go back to this place.. there are other spots to go.

detailedReviews.author: Michael Yekutiel
detailedReviews.text: I have made a reservation a long time before the time we came in and still waited a hour after our time to get in not even a one apology from one of the employees this place sucks

detailedReviews.author: Autumn Popphan
detailedReviews.text: It really does live up to the hype. It was worth the 30 minute wait after our reservation time which was frustrating but once we were seated the service was great. I‚Äôll be dreaming of the bread they bring out forever. Best Caesar salad I‚Äôve ever had! The only thing that didn‚Äôt quite impress me was the veal. Everything else we ordered was fantastic

detailedReviews.author: Landy Lin
detailedReviews.text:
This ended up being our favorite restaurant of the entire trip‚Äîwe loved it so much that I‚Äôm already planning to come back next month!

I‚Äôll admit, I was a little nervous when I saw the low Google rating. But I also noticed how hard it was to get a reservation, so I took a chance. I did have to wait about 30 minutes even with a reservation, which wasn‚Äôt ideal‚Äîbut everything after that more than made up for it.

The food was incredible. I loved the spicy vodka sauce, and the veal Parmesan (especially the bone) was a standout. The drinks were just as impressive‚Äîhands down the best espresso martini I‚Äôve ever had.

Service was top-notch. Richard and William were both attentive, warm, and fun‚Äîthey even did a little whiskey tasting with us. They really helped make the night special.

detailedReviews.author: Donavan Cox
detailedReviews.text:
Amazing dinner and service at Carbone as usual. We went for my girlfriend‚Äôs birthday and were originally seated in the bar dinner area. It was a little cold for our attire so we asked to be moved somewhere warmer. With no argument the manager had a new table ( booth ) ready for us. The seasonal caprese salad was unbelievable. The pastas were excellent. The veal parm was cooked perfectly. Obviously the price is on the higher side but not unreasonable.

I really don‚Äôt believe the amount of one star reviews. Honestly it seems suspicious or even orchestrated. Even if you didn‚Äôt have the best experience or had to wait. 1 star is totally false for this establishment.

detailedReviews.author: Joe Mangino
detailedReviews.text: The food was excellent. Our servers made the experience awesome. I highly recommend a visit to Carbone if you are in Las Vegas. I could eat the spicy rigatoni every day!

detailedReviews.author: Kenneth Davidsen
detailedReviews.text: Marvellous Restaurant.

detailedReviews.author: Lewis Mirrett
detailedReviews.text:
Me and my 4 friends had a dinner reservation here on July 10th at 6:30pm. We were all return customers ready to spend on food wine and cocktails.

First hurdle: My friend who made reservation texted to let them know we were running late. We arrived at 6:48pm, 3 minutes after our communicated arrival time (and their standard 15 minute grace period).

Not only was the hostess rude, dismissive, passive aggressive, and completely unaccommodating, she seemed please and almost gleeful to find any reason to turn us away (3 minutes late).

To top it off, I (being the only male in a group with 4 women) was told I wasn‚Äôt allowed in because I was wearing open toed shoes (designer peep-toe flats, which matched my girlfriends‚Äô shoes). Apparently they have a strict dress code for well dressed men to not wear the slightest open toed shoes‚Ä¶but women can.

I asked to speak to the manager about this, and just like the hostess, she seemed glad to tell me I couldn‚Äôt dine here (without any valid justification - just a fake sneer on her face saying ‚Äúit‚Äôs our policy‚Äù). Meanwhile men wearing casual workout running shoes walked in and out of the restaurant around us.

As repeat customers and friends and family of repeat customers, Carbone made it very clear that we are not welcome. We will not be spending another dime at any Carbone.

I would‚Äôve given 0 stars if I could. Perhaps Google should consider that as an option.

detailedReviews.author: Dee Scott
detailedReviews.text: The worst food I‚Äôve had yet. I waited an hour and 1/2 for my food even tho we had a reservation. My husband‚Äôs food was beyond disgusting. It was tasteless and bland. The waitress was very nice but the overall experience was not.

detailedReviews.author: C. Watkins
detailedReviews.text: I made a 9:30pm reservation for 4 people. We didn‚Äôt get sat until 10:15. I understand guest running over their table time, but 45mins late for a reservation is extreme. After being seated we put our orders in rather quickly. That order included ravioli, spicy rigatoni, shrimp Alfredo, & the salmon oreganata‚Ä¶.. Our meal also took an hour to come out. By now we‚Äôve pretty much filled up on the bread & no one was happy with their meal, I won‚Äôt even go into that detail. As much raving as I hear about this restaurant I was highly disappointed from beginning to end & although our server seemed apologize, she didn‚Äôt even attempt to turn around our feelings about this experience.

detailedReviews.author: Ruth Urquhart
detailedReviews.text: They‚Äôll charge you $74 if you‚Äôre 15 minutes late but will make you wait 45+ min even with a reservation. Miami location is worth it. Las Vegas is not. Don‚Äôt waste your time and money

detailedReviews.author: Daniela Siqueira
detailedReviews.text: N√£o respeitam o hor√°rio reservado. Atendentes mal-educadas e arrogantes.

detailedReviews.author: Erica Thomas
detailedReviews.text: Had a great experience here over dinnertime. Everything was delicious, especially the Vodka Rigatoni and the bread service. Don't skip the bread!

detailedReviews.author: Cary Tong
detailedReviews.text:
**Disappointed at Carbone Las Vegas ‚Äì Overhyped & Overpriced**

I was really looking forward to dining at Carbone, but unfortunately, the experience fell far short of expectations.

We had a reservation but were still delayed **45 minutes** before being seated. While the service was decent, the kitchen was painfully slow ‚Äî **we waited nearly an hour** for our food to arrive. When we asked why it was taking so long, our server explained that the chef didn‚Äôt like how our first ribeye came out and decided to remake it. Honestly, that sounded more like an excuse than the truth.

By the time the food finally hit the table, **we had all lost our appetite**. The meal itself was average at best, and certainly **not worth the \$500 bill**. For that kind of price, I expected exceptional food and a seamless experience ‚Äî not long waits, questionable excuses, and lukewarm entrees.

**Bottom line:** Carbone might have the name and vibe, but the food and execution don‚Äôt match the hype. Definitely not in a rush to go back.

detailedReviews.author: Brittany D
detailedReviews.text: I love every visit I take to carbine, the atmosphere is very nice,classy, elegant and in a way it does feel like home. Service is always amazing the food tastes exceptional. My favorite dish is the spicy rigatoni vodka. A MUST HAVE plus they give you complimentary rainbow cookies.

detailedReviews.author: smp
detailedReviews.text: Why make a reservation if there‚Äôs a 30 min wait to be seated?

detailedReviews.author: Qeauna McDonald
detailedReviews.text:
As someone who was very excited about trying this restaurant who waited weeks to secure a reservation and paid a $75 reservation fee, I expected a high standard of service that matched the restaurant‚Äôs reputation and price point. Unfortunately, my experience was anything but.

From the start, our server seemed more focused on delivering the well-rehearsed script of the night‚Äôs specials than actually listening to our specific requests. We made it very clear that we were not sharing a pasta dish, that I wanted pasta as my entr√©e, and that my partner would be ordering the salmon. Despite this, we were brought pasta, asparagus, and no salmon at all. We waited patiently for the mistake to be corrected, only to later be asked if we wanted dessert without any acknowledgment that a major part of our meal had never arrived.

To be told we never ordered the salmon was both shocking and frustrating. We were very specific in our communication, and it was disappointing to feel ignored. It seemed like the staff were more concerned with following a rigid dining format than listening to what we, the paying guests, wanted. I understand the restaurant aims for a curated experience, but that should not come at the cost of attentiveness or flexibility.

To make matters worse, on our way out, we passed a group of at least five staff members standing at the front. Not one of them acknowledged our presence, said thank you, or even made eye contact. For a restaurant of this caliber, this level of indifference is unacceptable. Even fast food establishments are more consistent in thanking their guests. There were other issues but these were worth the time I spent gathering my words.

I will say, on a positive note, the rigatoni was phenomenal and lived up to the hype truly the highlight of the evening. However, a single excellent dish does not make up for the disjointed and disappointing service experience that overshadowed the rest of our meal.
A restaurant charging premium prices and requiring a paid reservation should deliver not only excellent food, but equally attentive and respectful service. Sadly, this visit fell far short.

detailedReviews.author: Cam ‚ÄúCam‚Äù Martin
detailedReviews.text: Absolutely enjoyed our time here. The food, atmosphere, and team was very pleasant. I enjoyed the Pork Chops and Red Peppers. The Asparagus was grilled to perfection and the Potatoes with Duck fat was excellent. Be sure to try the Cauliflower OMG it was delicious.

detailedReviews.author: Amy N.
detailedReviews.text:
We ate at Carbone‚Äôs a couple of nights ago and I‚Äôm still trying to process our bizarre experience there. We‚Äôre pretty easygoing people and I‚Äôve never written a bad review before, but we walked in there excited for a good meal and walked away feeling insulted and confused.

We were seated and never asked about drinks or told about specials. Our waiter walked up to our table, stood there silently, no greeting or verbal prompt, and after a few awkward moments lifted his shoulders and said ‚ÄúSo are you going to order?‚Äù. We ordered the caprese salad, dover sole, and a side of corn. I asked for a glass of wine, which apparently offended our server because he literally responded ‚ÄúReally?!‚Äù and told me that it would numb my lips too much to enjoy the fish and he would never do that, but he‚Äôd bring it out to me anyway. I appreciate his intent of trying to guide me on the best pairing to enjoy the meal, but was surprised at the direct and almost rude communication style.

I will say that there was a sweet elderly lady dining solo seated next to us that seemed like a frequent visitor, and several staff members stopped to chat with her, even sitting down across from her to converse. So, we did witness other staff members being kind to patrons. The food tasted great, but was overshadowed by the horrible service. There are so many other great restaurants in Vegas that offer a more consistent and pleasant experience, we will never be visiting this Carbone‚Äôs location again.

detailedReviews.author: David Carol
detailedReviews.text: Was there recently, walked up to order To Go. The lady said they don't do To Go.  Guess they just want your tips and service charge. All I wanted was a Cesar salad!!   This represents the get tourist money at all cost.  I wasn't even staying at the hotel.

detailedReviews.author: Nick Isles
detailedReviews.text: Coming from NYC this was Hands down the best Italian meal and service we‚Äôve ever had in our lives. Our captain, Jimmy, and Server, Ethan made the experience unforgettable and we can‚Äôt wait for our next visit to Carbone. Thank you for the exceptional service and food. Was worth every penny.

detailedReviews.author: Gasper Manno
detailedReviews.text:
Chef needs to have knowledge of dishes on the menu. Chicken scarpariello was the worst ever.
Extremely disappointed!

detailedReviews.author: Jo
detailedReviews.text: Was not blown away by the restaurant but nevertheless the food was good. Service was a bit so so, especially when our main course was places on the table when we just started our starters (?!?)

detailedReviews.author: Kelly Dittmer
detailedReviews.text: The atmosphere was very elegant. The food was fantastic. I recommend the Lobster Ravioli & the Salmon. It was absolutely delicious. The service was great the hosts were very attentive. Unforgettable night.

detailedReviews.author: M M
detailedReviews.text: Starting with the rude host Yessenia very unprofessional and poor customer service to waiting forever for our entrees to come out. Atmosphere was nice the food fair needs major improvement with customer service the host made the experience awful had to speak with a manager.

detailedReviews.author: Victoria Bicondova
detailedReviews.text: The service was very attentive! The food overall was wonderful, but we didn‚Äôt like the Caesar salad; it was pungent and sour, which others may like we just didn‚Äôt. The rigatoni was the start like many others have claimed. The secret star was the focaccia bread with a slight layer of sauce on top that they bring out at the beginning. That was my favorite for sure! The meatballs were perfect. The Tiramisu was a Tiramisu cake and not true Tiramisu which they didn‚Äôt specify; it was okay. The cocktail was not good. I got a Manhattan and it was straight up a punch in the face of alcohol and didn‚Äôt taste like there was anything mixed in. Overall it was good! I don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôd go back, but that‚Äôs only because I have my Vegas restaurant favorites locked down.

detailedReviews.author: sandra arafat
detailedReviews.text:
The food did not disappoint here . Everything was amazing .
Presentation of everything here is so beautiful

detailedReviews.author: Èô≥Âª∫Ë©†
detailedReviews.text:
ÈùûÂ∏∏ÁæéÂë≥ËÄå‰∏îÊ≠£ÂÆóÁöÑÁæ©Â§ßÂà©Ëèú
Â∫óÂì°‰πüÈÉΩÂæàË¶™Âàá

detailedReviews.author: Bobo bear song
detailedReviews.text: Food had definitely superseded my expectations. Starting off with the Caesar salad that they make together in front of you to the very Flame‚Äô Banana Flamb√© all with the service of our exceptional service staff. It was definitely delicious! Can‚Äôt wait to come back.

detailedReviews.author: Scot Lenter
detailedReviews.text: Always perfect. Amazing service. Excellent food and drinks.

detailedReviews.author: Claudio Gonzalez Morano
detailedReviews.text: Top 5 - Italian

detailedReviews.author: Amy Smith
detailedReviews.text: Carbone in Vegas delivers an unforgettable experience! Every Italian dish our group shared was impeccable‚Äîmajor kudos to the chef. The wine list is top-tier, and the staff‚Äôs recommendations were spot-on. But the real standout? The service. The entire team made us feel like VIPs. Highly recommend!

detailedReviews.author: Jeff Slemp
detailedReviews.text: Do not eat here. They are the worst. Eat somewhere else worse service ever. Stay away.

detailedReviews.author: Jordan Medeiros
detailedReviews.text: Amazing food! Service could be a bit better as we found ourselves often waiting around for our waiter. It was nice to experience the restaurant as a whole though.

detailedReviews.author: Tee Kar
detailedReviews.text:
Carbone ‚Äì Las Vegas

Carbone is one of the most popular restaurants in Vegas, known for offering a high-end dining experience. While the service was phenomenal and the atmosphere was enjoyable, I found the food to be underwhelming given the price point. It‚Äôs worth visiting once just to check it off the list, but I highly doubt I‚Äôll return.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customer opinions are divided. The 3.4/5 rating from 100 recent reviews suggests some great experiences mixed with areas needing attention.

strengthsPerceived: Customers consistently praise the exceptional service and personalized attention from staff, highlighting memorable experiences with specific servers like Athena and Dion. - social media marketing can showcase this strength

The romantic and exquisite atmosphere is frequently mentioned as a highlight, making it a perfect spot for special occasions like weddings and celebrations. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility

The food quality, particularly dishes like the Spicy Rigatoni, is a standout feature that customers rave about, often describing it as worth the price and a must-try. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
improvementOpportunities: Long wait times and reservation issues - Boostly marketing services can improve this
Inconsistent service quality and lack of attention from staff - review management can address this concern
Negative reviews and reputation issues - review management can address this concern

positive.author: Marc G
positive.text: Great spot for a large group dinner. We were celebrating with clients and had the private room which was perfect. We ordered the tomahawk, 2 spicy rigatoni‚Äôs, tortellini al ragu branzino, rolls, and caprese salads

positive.author: r ferrusca
positive.text:
Outstanding and amazing. Service was beyond what I thought.
The food was spectacular. We had our wedding dinner here. It did not disappoint. We are from Dallas and are happy we chose to try this location first. The Dallas location will have very high standards to meet.

Thanks you all for making it an even more memorable evening.

positive.author: Dan Toomey Jr
positive.text: Not sure what the hate is about. A+ food, great service. Pricey but worth it

neutral.author: mike Stacks
neutral.text: Have to be honest people.  This place is üíØ overrated.  The server was good until we order our glass of wine. After that we never saw him again. Seemed like he was angry we didn't order a expensive dinner meal instead of side dishes.  What blew my mind was how expensive there shrimp cocktail is. $40 for 5 shrimp that were large. Not XL but just little over average size. No where did on the menu did it say 40$or I would have never got them. And besides the price they were horrible. Didn't seem fresh, we're kind of hard and this red seasoning to them. This place just seems way overpriced and while the other dishes were good,  nothing blew me away. I hate to drop 200 on a dinner when you have these hidden prices, below avergae service which was good for the 1st 30 min and then fell flat to bad.  As a server you take our order, get our drinks, everyone else brings the food and refills water and then you show at the end for your tip. Must be nice to have everyone else do your work for you and you get the tip... I will never go back to this place.. there are other spots to go.

negative.author: Bella Li
negative.text:
Really disappointing experience. üò§

We showed up on time with a reservation, dressed up, and still waited 30 minutes. When we politely asked, the host seemed annoyed. Our server never explained the menu to us, but did a full intro for the table next to us. He even dropped utensils on our table without looking‚Äîso rude. üíîWe paid $150+ per person and stayed polite the whole time, but got treated like this. Honestly, worst dining experience I‚Äôve had in Vegas‚ÄîIn-N-Out was better.

negative.author: Ron Larsen
negative.text:
Food quality was good; Captain's table service delivery was the worst fine dining experience of our lives...no exaggeration. He (no introduction) listed the specials he could remember, missing the lobster cocktail, among others, which sounded amazing when we got to hear about them listening to Athena deliver them to the table next to ours.

We selected the caprese salad, because I saw on the menu, that was not mentioned to us as their seasonal special with freshly made mozzarella and seasonal vine riped tomatoes...which we learned listening to other tables receiving recommendations.
Our Captain only came to check-in on us during the 30-45 minute wait between our pasta and $150 NY strip while we sat with empty white plates in front of us, frowning, as we listened to the amazing experience the table next to us was receiving.
So...after seeing our table neighbor's meal order (that was identical to our own) arrive with reasonable timing between dishes, after they'd received beautifully delivered recommendations, and enjoyed frequent table check-ins from their Captain to ensure their satisfaction, I asked our server, (who was great) to speak with management. Once management arrived, they listened to my polite summary and stated they agreed with me that the Captain working the table next to us, Athena, was the Superhero of the establishment and ours needed a time-out for additional training. I felt better for getting to vent, but received no apology or reasonable accomodation towards the $500 meal-for-two experience disaster we'd just endured.
We decided to skip desert and get the hell out of the establishment. We left 20% gratuity as our server, Keith, was amazingly attentive in watching our beverage refills, clearing plates, and efforts trying to connect... perhaps in response to what was lacking from our table Captain. We hope Keith's promoted to an establishment that deserves him as Carbone is a $500 dinner-for-two disaster unless sitting in Athena's section.

negative.author: Monica Niter
negative.text: This was my anniversary dinner and also a way to celebrate my husband‚Äôs birthday too! We explained this on the reservation and seems none of the information was seen. Reservation at 9. Seated at 9:30 and they close at 10:30 which I feel already set us up for failure. We sat down and got drinks from a server who was more attentive than our actual ‚Äúcaptain‚Äù the whole night and I can‚Äôt say thank you enough for him. Our captain basically ignored us all night, but was attentive with tables all around us. He only checked on us once the food arrived. We quickly ate just to get out the restaurant and enjoy our anniversary. We were even brought an incorrect check up charging desserts we didn‚Äôt order‚Ä¶ do better. We were excited and now have no desire to return

recommendations.title: Generate More Reviews
recommendations.description: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews

recommendations.title: Improve Customer Satisfaction
recommendations.description: Address common issues mentioned in reviews
recommendations.impact: Boost overall rating and customer retention
